document_title: Sleep disorders: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Are sleep disorders dangerous?
Have! Sleep disorders, if repeated over a long period of time, will affect the patient's quality of life. People with long-term sleep disorders are even more susceptible to physical weakness, increasing the risk of other diseases. If left untreated, prolonged sleep disorders can cause accidents in life that can lead to death.
What medicine should I take for sleep disorders?
There are many medications that can help support sleep disorders, such as chloral hydrate, benzodiazepine, zolpidem, amitriptyline, etc. However, patients should not use medication on their own but must have a doctor's prescription and Use exactly according to the dosage and condition prescribed by your doctor.
Do not arbitrarily use medication to treat sleep disorders
Can sleep disorders go away on their own?
Sleep disorders can be transient and then go away, but can also last a long time, affecting quality of life and requiring treatment. These can be natural remedies that do not use drugs, or they can also be treatments that require medication. Do not subjectively use medication on your own as it can make the illness worse and lead to dependence on sleeping pills.
Where should sleep disorders be examined?
Sleep disorders can be examined at the Neurology department at hospitals and medical facilities. The Department of Neurology of the Neurology Center, Tam Anh General Hospital System specializes in examination, consultation, and treatment of neurological diseases in general and sleep disorders in particular. The hospital brings together a team of leading doctors and experts with many years of experience in the field of treating sleep disorders.
The hospital invests in many modern equipment and machinery. Thanks to that, doctors can determine the cause of sleep disorders as well as have effective treatment methods, minimizing costs.
To schedule an examination and consultation on health issues at Tam Anh General Hospital System, please contact:
Sleep disorders greatly affect the health and life of patients. Please proactively go to the hospital for examination if you have symptoms of sleep disorders.
